title: Analysis of Frustration Factors and Persona Design for Collaborative Science Learning Among Adult Learners

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of fundamental science concepts and mobile device usage skills
context.additional_context: A process of collaborative learning through project-based assessment in a limited smartphone-based technological environment. Key challenges may include differences in role distribution and communication methods among learners

learning_goals: Three or more personal/collective frustration factors in collaborative learning can be identified using Q methodology
Five learner-trait-based personas can be analyzed to derive actionable insights for instructional design

Learners can form collaborative learning groups of three members using smartphone-based microlearning tools (e.g., WhatsApp, Telegram), share 10-minute video/image learning materials at least three times per week, and achieve over 80% participation and an average content quality score of 3.5 or higher on a 4-point rubric through peer evaluation.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
